Prosecutors: Bulger's immunity claim 'frivolous'

Federal prosecutors are opposing a request that the sitting judge in the James "Whitey" Bulger case recuse himself because he was once a prosecutor. (Boston Globe)

Cape kayaker paddled like 'no tomorrow'

Walter Szulc Jr. was about 50 yards off Nauset Beach when he noticed a man on a standup paddleboard pointing at something just behind him. (Boston Globe)

J.P. Licks, Kimball Farm, Ben & Jerry's, and BerryLine are among the top picks for ice cream in the region.

State Representative Carlos Henriquez allegedly punched and strangled woman

Accompanied by supporters, Henriquez today pleaded not guilty to kidnapping charges and was ordered to stay away from a female UMass-Boston student he allegedly assaulted. (Boston Globe)

AT&T may drop $1.15m suit against man

Michael Smith, a small business owner in Ipswich, may soon be off the hook for $1.15 million in fraudulent international phone charges. (Boston Globe)

Health & Wellness

Be Well, Boston | Video

CT scans linked to cancer risk

Kids who get several CT scans have a slightly higher chance of brain cancer and leukemia in later life, though the risk is still small and probably outweighed by the need to get the test, researchers said.
